segment.source: Follow the steps in this guide to quickly deploy Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0 or 2.1 in a small test environment.
segment.target: Follow the steps in this guide to quickly deploy Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0 or 2.1 in a small test environment.

segment.source: This helps you determine whether UE-V is the right solution to manage user settings across multiple devices within your enterprise.
segment.target: This helps you determine whether UE-V is the right solution to manage user settings across multiple devices within your enterprise.

segment.source: The information in this section is repeated in greater detail throughout the rest of the documentation.
segment.target: The information in this section is repeated in greater detail throughout the rest of the documentation.

segment.source: So if you already know that UE-V 2 is the right solution and you don’t need to evaluate it, you can just go right to Prepare a UE-V 2.x Deployment.
segment.target: So if you already know that UE-V 2 is the right solution and you don’t need to evaluate it, you can just go right to Prepare a UE-V 2.x Deployment.

segment.source: The standard installation of UE-V synchronizes the default Microsoft Windows and Office settings and many Windows app settings.
segment.target: The standard installation of UE-V synchronizes the default Microsoft Windows and Office settings and many Windows app settings.

segment.source: Make sure your test environment includes two or more user computers that share network access and you’ll be evaluating UE-V in just a short time.
segment.target: Make sure your test environment includes two or more user computers that share network access and you’ll be evaluating UE-V in just a short time.

segment.source: Step 1: Confirm Prerequisites: Make sure your environment is able to run UE-V, including details about supported configurations.
segment.target: Step 1: Confirm Prerequisites: Make sure your environment is able to run UE-V, including details about supported configurations.

segment.source: Step 2: Deploy the Settings Storage Location for UE-V 2: All UE-V deployments require a location for settings packages that contain the synchronized setting values.
segment.target: Step 2: Deploy the Settings Storage Location for UE-V 2: All UE-V deployments require a location for settings packages that contain the synchronized setting values.

segment.source: Step 3: Deploy the UE-V 2 Agent: To synchronize settings using UE-V, devices must have the UE-V Agent installed and running.
segment.target: Step 3: Deploy the UE-V 2 Agent: To synchronize settings using UE-V, devices must have the UE-V Agent installed and running.

segment.source: Step 4: Test Your UE-V 2 Evaluation Deployment: Run a few tests on two computers that have the UE-V Agent installed and see how UE-V works.
segment.target: Step 4: Test Your UE-V 2 Evaluation Deployment: Run a few tests on two computers that have the UE-V Agent installed and see how UE-V works.

segment.source: Once you follow the steps, you’ll be able to evaluate how UE-V can work in your enterprise.
segment.target: Once you follow the steps, you’ll be able to evaluate how UE-V can work in your enterprise.

segment.source: Further evaluation: You can also perform additional steps to configure some third-party and line-of-business applications to synchronize their settings using UE-V as detailed in Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications.
segment.target: Further evaluation: You can also perform additional steps to configure some third-party and line-of-business applications to synchronize their settings using UE-V as detailed in Deploy UE-V 2.x for Custom Applications.

segment.source: Before you proceed, make sure your environment includes these requirements for running UE-V.
segment.target: Before you proceed, make sure your environment includes these requirements for running UE-V.

segment.source: Standard, Enterprise, Datacenter, or Web Server
segment.target: Standard, Enterprise, Datacenter, or Web Server

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: MDOP License: This technology is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).
segment.target: MDOP License: This technology is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).

segment.source: Enterprise customers can get MDOP with Microsoft Software Assurance.
segment.target: Enterprise customers can get MDOP with Microsoft Software Assurance.

segment.source: For more information about Microsoft Software Assurance and acquiring MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=322049).
segment.target: For more information about Microsoft Software Assurance and acquiring MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=322049).

segment.source: Administrative Credentials for any computer on which you’ll be installing
segment.target: Administrative Credentials for any computer on which you’ll be installing

segment.source: Step 2: Deploy the Settings Storage Location for UE-V 2
segment.target: Step 2: Deploy the Settings Storage Location for UE-V 2

segment.source: You’ll need to deploy a settings storage location, a standard network share where user settings are stored in a settings package file.
segment.target: You’ll need to deploy a settings storage location, a standard network share where user settings are stored in a settings package file.

segment.source: When you create the settings storage share, you should limit access to users that require it.
segment.target: When you create the settings storage share, you should limit access to users that require it.

segment.source: Deploy a Settings Storage Location provides more detailed information.
segment.target: Deploy a Settings Storage Location provides more detailed information.

segment.source: Create a new security group and add UE-V users to it.
segment.target: Create a new security group and add UE-V users to it.

segment.source: Create a new folder on the centrally located computer that stores the UE-V settings packages, and then grant the UE-V users access with group permissions to the folder.
segment.target: Create a new folder on the centrally located computer that stores the UE-V settings packages, and then grant the UE-V users access with group permissions to the folder.

segment.source: The administrator who supports UE-V must have permissions to this shared folder.
segment.target: The administrator who supports UE-V must have permissions to this shared folder.

segment.source: Assign UE-V users permission to create a directory when they connect.
segment.target: Assign UE-V users permission to create a directory when they connect.

segment.source: Grant full permission to all subdirectories of that directory, but block access to anything above.
segment.target: Grant full permission to all subdirectories of that directory, but block access to anything above.

segment.source: Set the following share-level Server Message Block (SMB) permissions for the settings storage location folder.
segment.target: Set the following share-level Server Message Block (SMB) permissions for the settings storage location folder.

segment.source: Set the following NTFS file system permissions for the settings storage location folder.
segment.target: Set the following NTFS file system permissions for the settings storage location folder.

segment.source: List folder/read data, create folders/append data
segment.target: List folder/read data, create folders/append data

segment.source: If you create the settings storage share on a computer running a Windows Server operating system, configure UE-V to verify that either the local Administrators group or the current user is the owner of the folder where settings packages are stored.
segment.target: If you create the settings storage share on a computer running a Windows Server operating system, configure UE-V to verify that either the local Administrators group or the current user is the owner of the folder where settings packages are stored.

segment.source: To enable this additional security, specify this setting in the Windows Server Registry Editor:
segment.target: To enable this additional security, specify this setting in the Windows Server Registry Editor:

segment.source: Add a REGDWORD registry key named "RepositoryOwnerCheckEnabled" to HKEYLOCALMACHINESoftwareMicrosoftUEVAgentConfiguration.
segment.target: Add a REGDWORD registry key named "RepositoryOwnerCheckEnabled" to HKEYLOCALMACHINESoftwareMicrosoftUEVAgentConfiguration.

segment.source: Set the registry key value to 1.
segment.target: Set the registry key value to 1.

segment.source: The UE-V Agent synchronizes application and Windows settings between users’ computers and devices.
segment.target: The UE-V Agent synchronizes application and Windows settings between users’ computers and devices.

segment.source: For evaluation purposes, install the agent on at least two computers in your test environment that belong to the same user.
segment.target: For evaluation purposes, install the agent on at least two computers in your test environment that belong to the same user.

segment.source: Run the AgentSetup.exe file from the command line to install the UE-V Agent.
segment.target: Run the AgentSetup.exe file from the command line to install the UE-V Agent.

segment.source: It installs on both 32-bit and 64-bit operating systems.
segment.target: It installs on both 32-bit and 64-bit operating systems.

segment.source: You must specify the SettingsStoragePath command line parameter as the network share from Step 2.
segment.target: You must specify the SettingsStoragePath command line parameter as the network share from Step 2.

segment.source: Deploy a UE-V Agent provides more detailed information.
segment.target: Deploy a UE-V Agent provides more detailed information.

segment.source: Step 4: Test Your UE-V 2 Evaluation Deployment
segment.target: Step 4: Test Your UE-V 2 Evaluation Deployment

segment.source: You can now run a few tests on your UE-V evaluation deployment to see how UE-V works.
segment.target: You can now run a few tests on your UE-V evaluation deployment to see how UE-V works.

segment.source: On the first computer (Computer A), make one or more of these changes:
segment.target: On the first computer (Computer A), make one or more of these changes:

segment.source: Open to Windows Desktop and move the taskbar to a different location in the window.
segment.target: Open to Windows Desktop and move the taskbar to a different location in the window.

segment.source: Open Calculator and set to scientific.
segment.target: Open Calculator and set to scientific.

segment.source: Change the behavior of any Windows app, as detailed in Managing UE-V 2.x Settings Location Templates Using Windows PowerShell and WMI.
segment.target: Change the behavior of any Windows app, as detailed in Managing UE-V 2.x Settings Location Templates Using Windows PowerShell and WMI.

segment.source: Disable Microsoft Account settings synchronization and Roaming Profiles.
segment.target: Disable Microsoft Account settings synchronization and Roaming Profiles.

segment.source: Log off Computer A. Settings are saved in a UE-V settings package when users lock, logoff, exit an application, or when the sync provider runs (every 30 minutes by default).
segment.target: Log off Computer A. Settings are saved in a UE-V settings package when users lock, logoff, exit an application, or when the sync provider runs (every 30 minutes by default).

segment.source: Log in to the second computer (Computer B) as the same user as Computer A.
segment.target: Log in to the second computer (Computer B) as the same user as Computer A.

segment.source: Open to Windows Desktop and verify that the taskbar location matches that of Computer A. Verify that the default fonts match and that Calculator is set to scientific.
segment.target: Open to Windows Desktop and verify that the taskbar location matches that of Computer A. Verify that the default fonts match and that Calculator is set to scientific.

segment.source: Also verify the change you made to any Windows app.
segment.target: Also verify the change you made to any Windows app.

segment.source: You can change the settings in Computer B back to the original Computer A settings.
segment.target: You can change the settings in Computer B back to the original Computer A settings.

segment.source: Then log off Computer B and log in to Computer A to verify the changes.
segment.target: Then log off Computer B and log in to Computer A to verify the changes.

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For UE-V issues, use the UE-V TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For UE-V issues, use the UE-V TechNet Forum.
